episodes.seriesTitle: InvestTalk - Investment in Stock Market, Financial Planning, Retirement Planning, Money Management Podcast
episodes.title: Earnings Season Is Over With Slow Economic Growth Ahead in 2013
episodes.summary:
Market struggles to grow higher after a great January. While economic numbers are at an acceptable level but not surprisingly strong. Though the earnings were a little bit surprising during the earning season that was because the expectation were set so low. But overall, it was pretty much decent, of course, with the CEO's being guided higher. With the earning season over, what we are expected to see is slight improvement but nothing major. For instance, the unemployment claims this week was down a little bit but it's good enough to make a difference. More economic updates this week on the video.

episodes.seriesTitle: InvestTalk - Investment in Stock Market, Financial Planning, Retirement Planning, Money Management Podcast
episodes.title: 2013 US Economic Forecast Fiscal Cliff Continues, US Struggles From Recovery
episodes.summary:
The US produced 155,000 new jobs as per jobs report for December 2012 but not a very good number from a recovery from recession. In fact, it is one of the weakest recoveries from a recession. Eventually, the economy is not that very strong and the US is not producing more jobs. The stock market was doing well in 2012 and it will be in 2013 but, somehow, it will be a little bit rough though. Further, the US will still experience the continuation of the fiscal cliff from the previous year for a couple of months before the economy is going to take off.

episodes.seriesTitle: InvestTalk - Investment in Stock Market, Financial Planning, Retirement Planning, Money Management Podcast
episodes.title: A Stronger US Economy In 2013 Now That Everybodys Attention Is On Solving Fiscal Cliff
episodes.summary:
We have a very interesting report on the US Economic figures which looked pretty decent this week, though not that great, but they are really good. Certainly, the good news is that inflation is nowhere to be found. Industrial production surprisingly shot up by 1 percent both decrease and increase are attributed to Hurricane Sandy.

In other news, it seems like the US Fiscal Cliff is on everybodys mind now. And with all the debates, arguments, and the negotiations that are going back and forth, its going to swing the market up and down. But still the market believes that there’s going to be a middle of the road agreement which is going to lead to a stronger economy sooner.

episodes.seriesTitle: InvestTalk - Investment in Stock Market, Financial Planning, Retirement Planning, Money Management Podcast
episodes.title: Thinking Outside the Stocks [Webinar]
episodes.summary: Thinking Outside the Stocks is all about learning the new ways of the market, and how to organize your investments to fit the new realities of the market. If you get your investments back on the plus side, it won't likely be by following the same old rules.  It may not be by simply buying and selling stocks or mutual funds.  In this stock market and economy in transition there are new rules. Rather than pick through stocks one-by-one, smart investors are looking for opportunities which will drive business to sectors, industries and companies. And even if you're not a "Trader" or an experienced hands-on investor, this webinar will give you a step by step plan to get your retirement account back on track.
